newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Breakdown of Argentine 1997 planned budget savings. [CORRECTED 19:45 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Breakdown of Argentine 1997 planned budget savings. [CORRECTED 19:45 GMT]

text.p: The following is a breakdown of $3.85 billion in savings Argentina's Economy Minister Roque Fernandez Thursday told Congress he sees next year if it approves his fiscal package:
* $200 million -- tax on diesel fuel car sales (corrects to show that the tax applies to cars running on diesel, and not the fuel itself).
* $500 million -- cuts in tax and export reimbursements.
* $400 million -- raising tax on self-employed workers.
* $350 million -- extending the corporate income tax regime.
* $400 million -- extending VAT to various services.
* $250 million -- raising women's retirement age to 65.
* $150 million -- increase in withholding tax to 12 pct.
Fernandez also said additional revenue is expected from greater efficiency in tax collection.
